hi i have a qn about apt-get source pack: after i apt-get source <package name>
and run ./configure; make; make install
are the patches compiled too?
No.
If you want to apply patches, you need to apply them.
That is, apt-get source extracts source and applies diff, but does not apply patches included as a file in diff.
okay..
then how do i apply them?
(There is an ongoing discussion on how to automate that, actually. No solution for now.)
That's the bad part. There is no standard.
oh... ouch
how do i do it manually then?
Debian folks are working on it :(
It differs from packages to packages. Read package documentation if there is one.
wow... that sucks...
If there isn't, you need to figure it out.
hmm let me poke around the package and see if i can figure it out
the package in question is python-gobject btw
pygobject uses custom quilt rule. Use $ debian/rules patch to patch.
(And unpatch to unpatch.)
Some packages use apply/unapply for that.
Still some packages differ again...
Yes it sucks. People are working on agreeing on solution.
